qas.question: How many reef islands does the Tuvalu group have?
What are the number of true atolls are in the Tuvalu islands?
What is the total land area of Tuvalu?
How does Tuvalu rank in country size as compared to other nations?
What is the coverage of Tuvalu's economic zone?

context: Tuvalu consists of <a0_0>three<a0_0/> reef islands and <a1_0>six<a1_0/> true atolls. Its small, scattered group of atolls have poor soil and a total land area of only about <a2_0>26 square kilometres<a2_0/> (10 square miles) making it the <a3_0>fourth smallest<a3_0/> country in the world. The islets that form the atolls are very low lying. Nanumanga, Niutao, Niulakita are reef islands and the six true atolls are Funafuti, Nanumea, Nui, Nukufetau, Nukulaelae and Vaitupu. Tuvalu's Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) covers an oceanic area of approximately <a4_0>900,000 km2<a4_0/>.
